alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 4:08PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE ORANGE COUNTY COAST... ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE ORANGE COUNTY COAST... * LOCAL IMPACTS... A tsunami capable of producing strong currents that may be hazardous to swimmers, boats, and coastal structures is expected. Widespread inundation is NOT expected. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... If you are located in this coastal area, move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials. Tsunamis often arrive as a series of waves or surges which could be dangerous for many hours after the first wave arrival. The first tsunami wave or surge may not be the highest in the series. * FORECAST PEAK TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS... 1 to 2 foot waves are possible. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER... 18 cm at La Jolla and 44 cm in San Diego Bay. * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... A volcanic eruption occurred near the Tonga Islands of the South Pacific, generating a tsunami. * TIDE INFORMATION... Newport Beach...Low tides of 2.4 ft at 126 AM PST on Jan 16, and -0.8 ft at 304 PM PST on Jan 16. High tides of 5.9 ft at 741 AM PST on Jan 16, and 3.6 ft at 938 PM PST on Jan 16. La Jolla...Low tides of 2.3 ft at 122 AM PST on Jan 16, and -0.8 ft at 300 PM PST on Jan 16. High tides of 5.8 ft at 736 AM PST on Jan 16, and 3.5 ft at 936 PM PST on Jan 16. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
